meanings.definition: To draw off or convey (liquid) by means of a tube or pipe.
meanings.sent1: I watched as the mechanic was syphoning gasoline from the car.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was syphoning water from the well to irrigate the crops.
meanings.sent3: The magician amazed the audience by syphoning milk from a hat instead of a rabbit.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to syphon hope from his heart, leaving only despair.
meanings.sent5: The image of the vampire syphoning blood from his victim haunted her dreams.

meanings.definition: To take or transfer (something) secretly or dishonestly.
meanings.sent1: The spy was caught syphoning classified information from the computer.
meanings.sent2: She was accused of syphoning money from the company's accounts.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon was caught syphoning cookies from the jar in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The corrupt official was syphoning power from the government for personal gain.
meanings.sent5: The hacker was syphoning data from the network undetected.
